grand kids it odd to me do know my dad is my parent first and has no obligation to be involved with the children chose to have which is fine with me just because someone is biologically grandparent does mean he or she is required to help their kids nor does it mean he or she is capable of providing quality care it would certainly be nice for most people to have that and it seems to be sort of general rule in the us but would never trust my own parents alone with either of my children so have no expectations that either of them would babysit for me my mil is like that until recently she had zero interest in ever initiating contact with her only grandchild it was like pulling teeth to get any babysitting help and she only ever do it on her own terms at her house within certain hours etc which often made it unhelpful or even eliminated her as babysitting possibility recently we discovered that our daughter has become deathly allergic to cats it bad enough she needs an epi pen she gone into anaphylaxis because of it and grandma has three of them that means our kid ca set foot in my mil house ever again because she not about to get rid of them *now* my mil calls constantly and moans about how she never gets to see the kid anymore but is *still* almost completely unwilling to come to our house she done it twice in the months since the diagnosis and she only lives 15 minutes across town no sorry but no your parents had an obligation to provide you with food shelter love and support until you were 18 years old everything else after that is bonus some people are lucky and have parents who love being grandparents others do you just have to live with whatever you have that how felt as well we were *told* that they would help out as much as they could that they remembered what it was like and wanted to babysit so we could still feel like adults and couple yeahno they actually *watch* him maybe once every other month rarely for more than couple hours we make plans they offer
